description: Explore important events and figures from world history

questions.question: In which year did World War II end?
questions.explanation: World War II ended in 1945 with the surrender of Japan in September.

questions.question: Who was the first President of the United States?
questions.explanation: George Washington served as the first President of the United States from 1789 to 1797.

questions.question: Which ancient wonder of the world was located in Alexandria?
questions.explanation: The Lighthouse of Alexandria (Pharos of Alexandria) was one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.

questions.question: When did Indonesia declare its independence?
questions.explanation: Indonesia declared its independence on August 17, 1945, proclaimed by Sukarno and Mohammad Hatta.

questions.question: Which empire was ruled by Julius Caesar?
questions.explanation: Julius Caesar was a Roman general and statesman who played a critical role in the Roman Empire.

questions.question: In which year did the Berlin Wall fall?
questions.explanation: The Berlin Wall fell on November 9, 1989, marking the beginning of German reunification.

questions.question: Who was known as the 'Iron Lady'?
questions.explanation: Margaret Thatcher, the former British Prime Minister, was nicknamed the 'Iron Lady'.

questions.question: Which Indonesian hero is known as the 'Father of Indonesian Independence'?
questions.explanation: Sukarno was Indonesia's first president and is known as the Father of Indonesian Independence.

questions.question: When did the Majapahit Kingdom reach its peak?
questions.explanation: The Majapahit Kingdom reached its peak in the 14th century under Hayam Wuruk.

questions.question: Which European country first colonized Indonesia?
questions.explanation: The Netherlands (Dutch) was the primary European colonial power in Indonesia for over 3 centuries.
